授業目的:
This course aims to:
1. Develop basic understanding of various topics in business administration and economics
2. Develop an understanding of the impact of changing social, economic, technological and organizational topics
3. Prepare students to evaluate and apply certain theories of social science disciplines to workplace issues
4. Develop students’ ability to analyze and critically evaluate contemporary business issues
到達目標:
This course aims to:
1. Develop basic understanding of various topics in business administration and economics

特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
On completion of this course students should be able to:
1. Effectively choose key interests in business and economics topics
2. Examine current issues, trends, practices, and processes in in business and Economics
3. Be able to face contemporary business challenges

第1回: All 14 classes are face to face
第2回: Essential Business Management Reading: Developing Your Managerial Career
第3回: HBR Case Study: Can You Fix a Toxic Culture Without Firing People?
第4回: Essential Business Management Reading: Understanding Decision Making
第5回: HBR Case Study: Starbucks Coffee Company: Transformation and Renewal
第6回: Essential Marketing Reading: Understanding Digital Marketing
第7回: BR Case Study: THE YES: Reimagining the Future of E-Commerce with Artificial Intelligence (AI)
第8回: Essential Marketing Reading: Consumer Behavior and the Buying Process
第9回: HBR Case Study: THE YES: Reimagining the Future of E-Commerce with Artificial Intelligence (AI)
第11回: HBR Case Study: Nissan Motors: Corporate Governance Failure
第12回: Essential Accounting Reading: Preparing Financial Statements and Balancesheets
第13回: (HBR Case Study) Anandam Manufacturing Company: Analysis of Financial Statements
第14回: Essential Economics Reading: The US-China Trade War: Deal or No Deal? (JAPANESE), Japanese Version
第15回: HBR Case Study: China Plays Heavy Metal: Rare Earth Elements and the US Defence Industry
第16回: Essential Economics Reading; Japan’s Economy: Abenomics from the Front and Rearview Mirrors
